Description: Words as they appear in the stimuli texts. Words are split at white-space.
The index of the word in the text. Indexing starts at 1.
The index of the word in the sentence. Indexing starts at 1.
The index of a sentence in the respective text. Indexing starts at 1.
Word length is defined in number of characters including symbols like hyphens but without sentence punctuation at the end (i.e., z.B. = 4 characters; DNA-Kette =9 characters; eats.=4 characters
If a word is preceded by a punctuation mark, the STTS-PoS-tag of the punctuation mark is added here.
If a word is followed by a punctuation mark, the STTS-PoS-tag of the punctuation mark is added here.
Whether or not the word is part of an expression in quotes.
Whether or not the word is part of a phrase in parentheses.
Whether or not the word is the beginning of a clause.
Whether or not the word is the beginning of a new sentence.
Whether or not the entire word is an abbreviation.
1 if the word is a technical term that is not generally understandable. E.g.: "Agarose"
1 if the word is a technical term that is generally understandable. E.g.: "elektrisch"
Whether or not the word contains a symbol. E.g.: β-D-Glucose
Whether or not the word contains a hpythen. E.g.: 1 for DNA-Fragment. (*nicht* Wörter, die Tag TRUNC (Kompositions-ERstglieg) haben)
Whether or not the word contains an abbreviation. 0 for words that are only an abbreviation. See is_abbreviation. E.g.: 1 for DNA-Fragment, 0 for DNA

Possible values: NN: 38625, ART: 20700, APPR: 13800, ADJA: 11550, VVFIN: 7650, ADV: 5475, VAFIN: 5475, KON: 4950, ADJD: 3975, APPRART: 3600, VVPP: 2850, VVINF: 2475, PRELS: 2175, PPER: 1875, VMFIN: 1875, PRF: 1875, PAV: 1350, KOKOM: 1275, KOUS: 1200, PDAT: 1200, PTKVZ: 975, PIS: 750, PTKZU: 750, PIDAT: 675, CARD: 675, VAINF: 600, PDS: 525, PPOSAT: 525, PRELAT: 450, KOUI: 450, TRUNC: 375, PIAT: 375, PTKNEG: 300, NE: 300, VVIZU: 150, APZR: 75, PTKA: 75, VMINF: 75, PWAV: 75
Description: Part-of-speech tags according to the STTS-tagset. See stimuli/ANNOTATION.MD for more information.
"The orthographical representation of a word as found in the corpus; this data is case sensitive, i.e. there is a distinction between name and Name."
The length of the type of a word in characters. See the description of word length for a definition of how characters are counted.

Possible values: nn: 38100, art: 21000, appr: 13650, adja: 12150, vvfin: 7725, adv: 6825, vafin: 5475, kon: 4725, adjd: 4050, apprart: 3600, vvpp: 2850, vvinf: 2475, prf: 1875, prels: 1800, vmfin: 1800, pper: 1800, kokom: 1275, kous: 1200, pdat: 1200, ptkvz: 1125, pis: 1050, ptkzu: 750, card: 675, vainf: 600, pds: 525, pposat: 525, ne: 525, prelat: 450, trunc: 375, koui: 375, xy: 375, piat: 375, ptkneg: 300, vvizu: 150, pidat: 150, ptka: 75, vminf: 75, pwav: 75
Description: Part-of-speech tag as defined by the dlexDB query.
"The number of occurrences of an annotated type in corpus. An annotated type is a unique combination of a type, its part-of-speech tag and its lemma."

"The conditional probability of the bigram, given the occurrence of its first component. In other words, how likely it is for the second component to follow directly after the first. Here, this measure is computed on the basis of the annotated type information."

"The conditional probability of the trigram, given the occurrence of its initial bigram. In other words, how likely it is for the third component to follow directly after the initial pair. Here, this measure is computed on the basis of the annotated type information."
First-fixation duration: duration of the first fixation on a word if this word is fixated in first-pass reading, otherwise 0

Single-fixation duration: duration of the only first-pass fixation on a word, 0 if the word was skipped or more than one fixations occurred in the first-pass (equals FFD in case of a single first-pass fixation)
First duration: duration of the first fixation on a word (identical to FFD if not skipped in the first-pass)
First-pass reading time: sum of the durations of all first-pass fixations on a word (0 if the word was skipped in the first-pass)

First-reading time: sum of the duration of all fixations from first fixating the word (independent if the first fixations occurs in first-pass reading) until leaving the word for the first time (equals FPRT in case the word was fixated in the first-pass)
Total-fixation time: sum of all fixations on a word (FPRT+RRT)
Re-reading time: sum of the durations of all fixations on a word that do not belong to the first-pass (TFT-FPRT)

Inclusive regression-path duration: Sum of all fixation durations starting from the first first-pass fixation on a word until fixation a word to the right of this word (including all regressive fixations on previous words), 0 if the word was not fixated in the first-pass (RPD_exc+RBRT)

Exclusive regression-path duration: Sum of all fixation durations after initiating a first-pass regression from a word until fixating a word to the right of this word, without counting fixations on the word itself (RPD_inc-RBRT)
Right-bounded reading time: Sum of all fixation durations on a word until a word to the right of this word is fixated (RPD_inc-RDP_exc)
Fixation: 1 if the word was fixated, otherwise 0 (FPF or RR)
First-pass fixation: 1 if the word was fixated in the first-pass, otherwise 0
Re-reading: 1 if the word was fixated after the first-pass reading, otherwise 0 (sign(RRT))
First-pass regression: 1 if a regression was initiated in the first-pass reading of the word, otherwise 0 (sign(RPD exc))
Total count of incoming regressions: total number of regressive saccades initiated from this word
Total count of outgoing regressions: total number of regressive saccades landing on this word
Landing position: position of the first saccade on the word expressed by ordinal position of the fixated character
Incoming saccade length: length of the saccade that leads to first fixation on a word in number of words; positive sign if the saccade is a progressive one, negative sign if it is a regression

Outgoing saccade length: length of the first saccade that leaves the word in number of words; positive sign if the saccade is a progressive one, negative sign if it is a regression; 0 if the word is never fixated
The accuracy of background question 1. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
The accuracy of background question 2. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
The accuracy of background question 3. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
The accuracy of text question 1. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
The accuracy of text question 2. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
The accuracy of text question 3. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
The mean accuracy of all background questions for one text read by one reader.
The mean accuracy of all text questions for one text read by one reader.
Numerical value of text_domain.
Each participant reads all 12 texts, the order of which follows their trial number. If text b0 has trial number 2 for participant 5, this participant read text b0 as the second text.
Unique identifier given to each stimulus text.
The unique identifier given to each reader. Reader IDs start at 0.
Numerical value of gender.
Numerical encoding of the reader domain.
Reader's age.
Numerical value of expert_status
Numerical value of domain_expert_status
